__e: I know that he seemed like a monster, but he wasn't.
I objected even to that. And now you make him out to be a murderer.
No, you're making him sound like a monster and he's not.
I thought you could possibly be out to make me look like a bad person.
We could be in that twin bed at your folks' house trying to pretend like we're a happy couple.
Because what if I think the truth makes me a bad person?
They may look like us and talk like us, but they are not like us.
Got me looking like less than a man in front of my wife.
The last thing I want to do it seems that ... last thing I want to do dancing. Understand?
He set fire to a building so he could look like a hero.
I didn't come fon/vard with my affair... because I knew it would make me look really, really bad.
NOW, THAT'S WHAT A RIVER SHOULD LOOK LIKE.
She has me, someone who understands how important it is to look her best... clearly something you give zero patoots about.
You said you bought it because it's always important to look your best when you feel your worst.
Just because you've had a little setback doesn't mean you can't look your best.

And they are good at looking one way and being another way.
I'm sorry to show up like this, I just didn't know where else to go.
If I'm going to be in a book, at least let me show you what I can do.
I need you to do everything you can to make her look the best she possibly can.
Maybe he was trying to lie his way into your next book. We both know the truth doesn't matter to you.
I call him and ask him will he be in the movie, and he's like, "Sure!"
That 's the thing-- ever since we realized "A" made Ian's death look like a suicide, we've been thinking that "A" and the killer are the same person.
